channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2024020896
item.description:
Report X-2024020896

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-03
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in a carrying tote sitting outside of the Hazmat cage. Bottom closure was open and 4 bottles were facing upward. DescribePack: Upon inspection, all caps were tight and no active leakage was found when bottles were turned over. One bottle was half empty, suggesting that the cap was previously loose. Wet marks were seen on the top portion of the box. Shipping label was completely faded. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was contained in a plastic Hazmat bag inside of a tote when found.

DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was secure in a Hazmat bag inside of a tote when found. Leakage was not spreading.

item.title: Report E-2024020370
item.description:
Report E-2024020370

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding (2) punctured bags containing Sodium Sulfide, Hydrated that released approximately 1-cup of product onto the wooden trailer floor. The punctured occurred because of a pallet jack. A Contractor cleaned-up the spill and containerized the damaged bags and shrink wrap in (1) 55DF for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024021011
item.description:
Report X-2024021011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: HUTCHINS

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA placed the bucket in black tub for hazmat when they realized the it was leaking. DescribePack: At first glance the bucket looks like it is in good condition until I saw a small puddle forming at the bottom. When examining the bucket, it was then when I realized it has a small hole near the bottom. The bucket will still slowly leak out the hazardous material while stand up correctly. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: It was placed in a black tub until I came around to place it in yellow drum.

item.title: Report E-2024020344
item.description:
Report E-2024020344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 7, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2929 was damaged due to unknown reasons and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed the released material evaporated from the loading dock floor prior to their arrival. E3 personnel placed the damaged 5-gallon pail into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for further evaluation.

item.title: Report X-2024020894
item.description:
Report X-2024020894

  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: sequence of events are unknown. Hazmat team was called to come and remove package from dock area. DescribePack: The plastic pail is busted almost half way around the circumference of the bottom of the pail. As a result, the chlorine granules began to spill out of container into the bottom of the box and eventually outside of the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazbag and put into a hazardous tote and brought to the HMPA for further examination.

item.title: Report E-2024020471
item.description:
Report E-2024020471

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-22
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG ENERGY, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, a vehicle drove through the coned off delivery area and struck the hose adaptor. This caused the hose adaptor to become dislodged from the storage tank and resulted in 50 gallons of gasoline being released. Lone Star Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package came in contact with a sharp object and started leaking. DescribePack: The box is wet and torn at the top and at the same side the corrosive label is on. One jerrican is leaking through a hole on the side. One jerrican is missing its cap and is completely empty. The last two jerricans has loose cap and lost some of it contents. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was put in a bag then place in a black tub for hazmat.

item.title: Report X-2024020708
item.description:
Report X-2024020708

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler noticed that the package was leaking. This led them to notify their direct manager, who then took the package to our damages area. It was here that one of our Admins brought the package, to the damaged hazmat processing area. DescribePack: There is a major dent directly under the lid. This is where the contents are leaking from. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was separated from other packages by being placed in a damaged hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020718
item.description:
Report X-2024020718

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The incident occurred inside a trailer in unload 3. The hazmat was already on top of some other boxes when the trailer arrive at the door. Before the package handler start on the trailer, the hazmat fell over and stated to leak it contents. Hazmat team was then called to clean up the area. DescribePack: The outer package was wet on one corner and stated to tare along the wet side. Half of the inner box was wet but there was not torn. The jerrican that was leaking (Rapicide PA Part A) had a loose cap. The remaining three jerricans are still in good condition. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Manager called hazmat to came clean up the spill. The package was carefully placed in a hazard bag and the spill was clean up using adsorbents. Hazmat made sure area was safe to work in after clean up.

item.title: Report X-2024020636

Report X-2024020636

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was unloaded from the trailer already leaking due to lose cap not being properly sealed, causing its contents to leak, Hazmat was immediately processed, on DPR, ISF, Hess DescribePack: Hazmat Metal can had a loose cap causing contents to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat package was taken immediately to the Hazmat cage to prevent other packages from getting damaged and stop the strong odor from its liquid.

item.title: Report X-2024020662
item.description:
Report X-2024020662

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A QA admin found the package under the IC belt while they were walking the C wing. The package was mostly dry on discovering but hazmat was still called to pick it up. DescribePack: The box was dry but it was easy to see that all of the edges was wet at one point. Which would explain why some areas are torn, crumbling, or missing some peace. The jerrican was found next to the box and it was dirty and some of its labels are damage. It also has a loose lid and would leak if it was tilted to the side the cap is on. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the bag and immediately to hazmat.

The jerrican had lost half of it contents from leakage. The reaming three jerricans are still in good condition. item.title: Report X-2024020668

item.title: Report X-2024020613
item.description:
Report X-2024020613

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-14
  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was already in a bag in QA before hazmat team arrive. There was no indication that the package was a hazmat aside from the flammable liquid label. DescribePack: The package was only wet on the same side the flammable liquid was on. Once the box was opened, it was discovered that the leakage came one jerrican with a loose cap. This jerrican had already lost about half it contents and would leak a great amount if tilted to the side. The remaining three jerricans were not damage and is in good condition. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA double bagged the package and place in a black tub for hazmat.

Google, face mask and gloves. Tote was taken to Hazmat Cage for further processing. DescribePack: Lid came loose during shipping. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was up righted and immediately cleaned up affected area.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package found at the beginning of sort leaking by the unload door. Upon retrieval of the hazmat package was placed inside a hazmat bag with red tote. Other non hazmat packages were damaged as well. Non Hazmat packages will not be sent out due to wet liquid residue on packages. DescribePack: Package was wet and torn from the bottom due to liquid being corrosive. 1 liquid container was found half empty with loose lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat package was place inside bag within red tote. Non Hazmat packages were placed separate from each other and placed under the hood within the Hazmat cage.

PH called out for a damaged hazmat and QA took the package to hazmat cage for inspection. Upon QA inspection it was discovered that the caps to 2 of the gallons of menthol were loose and had caused a leakage of 1.5 Gallons. DescribePack: Loose caps. Leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a hazardous waste only bin and removed from unload to hazmat cage for inspection.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0900 on 11/30/23 it was noted that the car in question was leaking down both sides of the car from under the dome lid, the car owner was notified and sent representitives from Haz Mate Special Services to inspect, they discovered that the car was leaking due to a defective gasket between on the liquid line in between the pressure plate and the valve flange. This gasket was changed out and the car was pressure tested by Eagle Car.

item.title: Report I-2023110073
item.description:
Report I-2023110073

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T00:33:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: BROWNSVILLE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COASTAL TRANSPORT CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The cargo tank motor vehicle was loaded with 9700 gallons of gasoline. The driver attempted to make a 90 degree turn to the left from one roadway to another at an intersection. The vehicle's speed was too fast for conditions. The liquid load surged to the passenger side of the vehicle. The sudden weight shift to the right side caused the unit to roll over onto its right (passenger) side. The vehicle came to rest partially on the pavement and the grassy shoulder on the right side of the roadway. The driver exited from the tractor cab by crawling through the windshield frame opening. As the vehicle was lying on its right side, the liquid level rose above the manhole/venting fixtures. Gasoline began seeping through the venting fixture. The local fire department and HM response personnel placed absorbent materials around the unit. HM response personnel performed a "cold tap" drilling procedure on the side of the semi-trailer. A suction hose and pump was used to transfer product from the overturned unit into a recovery cargo tank motor vehicle. After off loading was completed, product measurements revealed approximately 450 gallons of gasoline had leaked through the venting fixture. The leaked product found its way to the ground surface alongside the pavement. Lone Star HazMat response is handing the removal and replacement of any contaminated earth alongside of the pavement.

PACKAGE SHOWED STAINS OF LEAKAGE, WITH FULL PPE, RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE APPORIATE RESPONSE SHEET (NO LABEL ON BOX OR UNKNOWN, UNDECLARED). THEN BROUGHT IT TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
